content.description: Short but stout! Easy climbing up to the handjam pocket leads to a left angling crack/rail. Punch it through the rest of the climb as key holds become smaller and easy to miss.
content.location: First line on the far west end of the crag.

content.description: You can do this the easy way or the hard way. Don't get caught in the wrong position or you might find yourself stuck! Climb the techy vertical face on some good and some bad holds. Very thought provoking movement. This route is great but could use some traffic as it is pretty dirty up top.
content.location: 3rd west-most line on the wall. Just to the right of the big boulder in the middle of the crag.

content.description: Cruxy climbing down low leads to a cruiser finish on fun but repetitive moments.
content.location: Mid crag just left of the large boulder in front of the approach trail.

content.description: Easy climbing to the first bolt. Lieback and bear hug your way up the refrigerator on great holds. Try not to blow it on the perplexing sloper rail. Fairly easy with the correct beta but tough to onsight!

Seems from recent photos this line might be under attack by the branches from the pine parallel. Pity cause its decent. Awkward shoulder move at the third/fourth bolt gives way to better climbing above.
content.location: Start on same ramp as shocker and trends left under the overhang.

content.description: Easy climbing on big holds leads to a more thin techy crux. Less obvious features begin to appear and really make this climb interesting.

Easy climbing up the flake to the first bolt. Reach for the jug above and prepare for the business. Pull big powerful moves on underlings and crimps. Climb through ever-worsening holds and work yourself over the bulge using good body positioning/balance. Finish the route by pulling big moves on small but good holds. Clip the anchors from the obvious jug above.

Will someone just send this thing? Namesake of killer Crag and still a project as far as I know. Someone will unlock it. I seem to remember thinking it might go via a techy compression sequence. Steep short and savage.
content.location: Start from the chossy ramp below the overhanging block/face just left of blue mask, immediately make 2 hard clips then get out your magic wand.

content.description: The sharpest rock up there. The crazy porcupine texture makes for unique climbing but you might tape your tips. More overhung than it looks from below. I recall I couldnt quite get through the crux first time up it and used a knot jammed inÂ  between two sharp knobs to aid between bolts.
content.location: The trail dumps you out right beneath it. Start on the same ramp below the D project
